Recent updates from New York City include a tragic pedestrian fatality in the Bronx, a five-alarm apartment fire, a baby formula recall linked to botulism, and ongoing discussions about housing affordability as median home prices reach record highs amidst a housing crisis.

### Risks & Alerts

- 68-year-old pedestrian fatally struck by box truck in the Bronx. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Firefighters battle five-alarm fire in Bronx apartment building; evacuations underway. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMifkFVX3lxTE9ITlRRbFN0WWFrMk12bW9JSFc3TW1iblh6T1I0OEhyeUkwVHB5bW9YVW44ZjlHNVZTM0FjME5ZbW8tdi1oVWpfSy13UnIxSV8yVm5oRnFkTEFOOHpUcXd5M2I5S3ZRM19mdWZ3MXJsdFBTNS1Xd2lTWG02ZVU2UQ?oc=5)
- Baby formula recall issued after suspected botulism case linked to ByHeart product in Nassau County. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)

### Civics & Politics

- NYC housing affordability crisis worsens as median home prices reach a new record high. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Adams administration proposes new rules for legalizing basement and cellar apartments in NYC. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Another challenge for Mayor Mamdani: plummeting enrollment in the city’s public schools.
